revised_title: Surface Flow in Crystalline Solids under Mechanical Disturbance: Observations on Antimony and Calc-Spar
tldr: The author investigates the surface flow in crystalline solids, specifically antimony and calc-spar, under mechanical disturbance. Observations show that under certain conditions, these brittle, crystalline materials can form a smooth varnish-like covering, smoothing and rounding irregularities. The study also highlights the role of pressure and the seizing of the metal surface in the flow process.
